title:
Small Business News | Microsoft launches AI assistant, SMBs combat surge in 
cybersecurity, Jan. 31 tax deadline
text:
Microsoft Copilot virtual assistant now open to small businesses, individuals
Small business owners can now access the artificial intelligence-powered Microsoft Copilot virtual assistant through their Microsoft 365 Business Premium or Business Standard subscriptions. Microsoft Copilot is a generative text platform giving users the ability to receive detailed answers to queries or create content based on specific inputs. Read More Small business owners combat surge in cybersecurity threats
Cybersecurity remains one of the top concerns for entrepreneurs as the number of small businesses impacted by a digital attack hits 44%. That data comes from online security platform McAfee in collaboration with Dell Technologies, who conducted a survey of 700 company owners, managers, and leading I.T. professionals across six countries, including the U.S. Read More Jan. 31 is the last day to submit wage statements, independent contractor forms to IRS
The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) has issued a reminder to employers that the deadline for submitting wage statements and independent contractor forms is January 31. Employers must file their copies of Form W-2, Wage and Tax Statement, and Form W-3, Transmittal of Wage and Tax Statements, with the Social Security Administration by January 31. Read More SBA celebrates record number of business applications in 2023
Americans submitted 5.5 million business applications in 2023, an all-time high marking the third consecutive year of record-breaking growth.
